chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant LeRoy James Hamm was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. LeRoy James Hamm is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • LeRoy James Hamm was found guilty of Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall recieve credit for 45 days.  Court deems sentence served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. LeRoy James Hamm

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #5
Associated with Charge #5

Defendant LeRoy James Hamm in court with attorney Kevin Michael Schram.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls cases at 2:48 p.m.  States agreement:  As to 16CF19, def shall plead NC to Count #1 as PTAC and Count #3.  Counts #2 and 4-7 will be dismissed.  As to 15CM14, case will be dismissed.  As to 16CM40, Counts #1-4 will be dismissed and def will plead NC to Count #5.  Court grants all dismissals.  As to 16CM40, Count #5, def pleads NC per atty.  Def agrees.  As to 16CF19, Counts #1 and #3, def pleads NC per atty.  Def agrees.  PLQ has been filed.  Court questions defendant re pleas.  Def confirms going through PLQ with attorney.  Atty Schram is satisfied def freely, knowingly and intelligently pleads.  Court accepts pleas and finds guilty of Count #1 in #3 in 16CF19 and orders as follows:  Sentence Withheld, 2  years Probation.  If probation is revoked, def shall recieve 227 days credit for time already served.  Def shall pay one set of costs.  Court states no DNA sample is required as one is already on file.  Court also finds def guilty of Count #5 in 16CM40 and orders as follows:  45 days in ICJ with credit for time served of 45 days.  $1100 inclusive of costs, 12 month revocation of DL and 12 month IID.  Sentences are concurrent.  Adj.  2:58 p.m.  klr
and Petition for Review and Reduction of Bail
Def's
Pre-trial conference on August 8, 2017 at 10:30 am.

Defendant LeRoy James Hamm in court with attorney Kevin Michael Schram.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls case at 10:34 a.m.  Requests this case to trail 15CF19.  Court questions atty Schramm if objects to cases tracking together.  Atty Schram objects to all being set for same trial, but doesn't object to schedule together.  Court grants sufficient time for scheduling.  Partis to confer with JA.  Bond continues.  Adj.  klr
Status conference on May 23, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant LeRoy James Hamm in court with attorney Kevin Michael Schram.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls13CF10, 15CM14, 16CM40, and 16CF19, cites appearances.  Atty Schramm requests reconsideration of bond.  Def unable to post cash.  Requests modify bond or expedited scheduling.  DA agrees with expedited scheduling.  Court agrees, bond to continue.  Cases to be scheduled with JA.  Speedy trial in 15CM14 and 16CM40.  Court assigns all cases back to Mr. Tingstad.  Prelim to be set in 16CF19 for 5/23 at 10:00 a.m.  Speedy trial demand made in court.  August 3rd as #1 trial.  9:00 a.m. attorneys to be present, 10:00 trial.  Various other matters to be scheduled.  Adj. 10:17 a.m.  klr

(This bond covers 13CF10, 15CM14, 15CM40, and 16CF19 and new pending charges).  Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.  Must submit to chemical test if requested.  No alcohol, no controlled substances, no taverns, no liquor stores, no driving.  No contact with K.S.

Cortney J. Latzig appears on behalf of def, who is not present.  Matthew J. Tingstad appears on behalf of the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls cases 16TR399, 16CM40, 15CM14, 16TR400, 16CF19, and 13CF10.  Some cases were set for PTC and 16CF19 was set for motion hearing.  Atty Latzig makes oral motion to withdraw as counsel based on lack of communication.  Court grants motion to withdraw.  DA requests warrant.  Court authorizes warrant.  Regarding motion on 16CF19, DA moves for motion to be denied, court denies motion.  Adj.  klr

PTC was scheduled in most matters but 16CF19 was set for motion.  Attorneys have a joint recommendation to adjourn to 3/30/17 at 10:00 a.m.  Court grants request.  Adj. 10:23.  klr

(This bond covers 13CF10, 15CM14, 16CF19, 16CM40 and pending charges.)  No alcohol, no controlled substances, no taverns, no liquor stores, no driving unless has valid license.  No contact with K.S.

Defendant LeRoy James Hamm in court with attorney Courtney J Latzig.  Frederick j Schellgell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls the following cases:  16TR399,400,401, 15CM14, 16CF19, 13CF10, 16CM40.  Regarding citation in case #16TR401, DA moves to dismiss as it is covered in 16CM40-court grants.  As to 16TR399 and 401, defendant pleads NG per attorney Latzig.  13CF10 and 15CM14:  Per DA, were set for PTC.  Still working on resolution and request adjournment to 10/3/16.  16CM40, Amended complaint has been filed adding Ct#4 and Ct#5.  Initial being held on additional counts.  Per attorney Latzig, initial being held is acceptable.  Complaint served and def waives reading.  Defendant stands mute.  Clerk to enter NG pleas.  16CF19:  Was set for a motion to be adjourned to 10/3.  Attorneys have discussed bond.  DA requests bond of $250 with conditions of no alcohol, no controlled substances, no taverns, no liquor stores, no driving without valid license, no contact with K.S.  Court sets omnibus bond for all cases.  klr

(This bond covers 13CF10, 15CM14, 16CF19, 16CM40 and pending charges.)  No alcohol, no controlled substances, no taverns, no liquor stores, no driving.  No contact with K.S.  Defendant (or through attorney) shall provide verification of mother's address and that defendant is able to live there prior to release if posts bond.
Pre-trial conference on August 18, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Attorney Courtney J Latzig in court.  Frederick j Schellgell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls cases, cites appearances.  Defendant not present.  Was originally scheduled for a preliminary hearing on 16CF19.  Atty. Latzig only represents def on criminal matters.  A warrant is authorized at the discretion of the DA.  Atty. Latzig grants 10-day continuance on all matters.  To be reset.  klr
Pre-trial conference on July 21, 2016 at 10:45 am.

(This bond covers 13CF10, 15CM14, 15CM40, and 16CF19).  $200 cash is remaining to be posted as defendant posted $50 in 15CM14.  No alcohol, no controlled substances, no taverns, no liquor stores, no driving.  No contact with K.S.  Defendant (or though attorney) shall provide verification of mother's address and that defendant is able to live there prior to release if posts bond.

Defendant LeRoy James Hamm in court with attorney Courtney J Latzig (via phone).   Frederick J. Schellgell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls case, cites appearances.  Attorney Latzig is requesting modification of bond.  Argues motion.  DA expresses concerns, requests verification that def can live at mother's home.  Attorney Latzig to contact mother and verify and let court know.  Court amends bond to omnibus bond of $250 with conditions of no alcohol, no controlled substances, def is to live at mother's residence and provide verification that he is able to stay there prior to release.  No contact with K.S. and all other conditions previously set.  Def has posted $50 in prior case so remainder to be posted to fulfill this bond is $300 per court.  Once attorney Latzig provides verification of mother's address and ability to reside there, bond will be changed.
